Resident
2016 - 2017 Recommended Property Reviewed 11/22/2017
The front staff are great and very friendly (the complex gets package deliveries to the office, so I see them on a regular basis). The location is great for the GoTriangle transit system, which goes to Duke, UNC, and Raleigh. The grounds are well maintained and really close to the American Tobacco Trail, which makes going out for a walk easy, despite the suburban locale. The parking lot is fairly dark, so I take care when parking at night to make sure I'm parked somewhere I feel comfortable. We live in an upgraded unit with new appliances and kitchen finishes, which are lovely. The little study 'nooks' in the apartment are also a nice bonus space. I agree with a prior poster that the valet trash is nice, but not something I would opt in to pay for if I had a choice. My only real compliant is that the walls are a bit thin. We're on the top floor and have neighbors to the side, who I've never heard, and neighbors to the back (where our master bedroom is). We can regularly hear the neighbors that are behind our bedroom wall talking/yelling/slamming doors at night, which is frustrating. Because of the late hour and the fact that the neighbors are in a different building, it makes it difficult to ask them to quiet down. Other than that, we've been very happy with the complex and its staff!

Report
Resident
2017 Recommended Property Reviewed 11/16/2017
Overall, we love living at The Lodge! Staff: The front desk staff is super friendly and nice! They go above-and-beyond to help sign for my packages and send me reminders. Our apartment is one of the renovated units and it's beautiful! We have a nicely-sized kitchen with granite countertops and new appliances, which is hard to find. It's a great layout, too (type B2), with a second floor apartment and a first floor entrance. Location: I love being walking distance from the mall and shopping areas, and being so close to the Tobacco Trail is great for our pup! The dog park is also a critical add. Amenities: They've recently renovated the fitness center, too, and that's really nice. Apartment Interior: The only downside to our layout is that the tight stairway made it impossible to get our couch up the stairs. On move-in day we had to emergency-sell the couch and buy a cheap couch-in-a-box to be sure it would fit, so I would have appreciated a warning. The couch was a big reason we hired movers, so we could have sold it before moving and saved ourselves time, money, and a huge headache. The air conditioning unit is quite loud when it kicks on, and it's right out in the main living space, so we have to turn up the TV when it is on - not a huge inconvenience. I saw a review before we moved in that said the walls were thin, and I would definitely agree. After a couple weeks post-move-in, we finally spoke to our neighbor on our own to ask them to turn down their loud music (with a big bass line), but we still hear him from time to time. The staff tried to help by posting reminders, but I would have liked them to intervene more specifically. Services: Valet trash is nice to have, but I probably wouldn't pay for it if I had the choice. They make you bag up your boxes, so sometimes we end up just walking our recycling over to the bins anyway. We pay more for rent than you could get if you had a longer lease. Grounds: We live on the extension of the complex, so they simply do not seem to care as much about the appearance as they do on the main side. It's nice when you first drive in, but we have loads of bugs and webs and stuff surrounding our mailbox area, so that's always an unpleasant experience. I often have to make maintenance requests for our entryway as well, as the light is filled with bugs... not a welcoming appearance. However, my requests are always promptly attended to. The maintenance crew is super nice. I also appreciate that they leaf-blow and clear the sidewalks on a weekly basis. Safety: I always feel safe, but I had a neighbor tell us that her car was stolen one night when it was parked out of view of a window. We always lock our door when we leave, and there are two deadbolts, so I feel safe, but we had another notice of a break in. So, one stolen car and one burglary in the complex in our year living here. Pets: The pet fee is pretty high $350 when you also add $15/mo for pet rent, but they are pet friendly. My pup loves going to the front desk with me to get a milkbone from the staff. :) In summary, there are some typical apartment issues, but nothing that angers me or feels unjust. My husband and I are very happy living at the Lodge!

Report
Resident
2016 Recommended Property Reviewed 01/20/2016
I just moved to the apartments. I will write a review now because I was very pleased with their service. I will leave a review when I move out to write about the whole experience. I have been looking at apartments for a while now and I have seen nearly all the apartment complexes in this area (south durham). Most of them had leasing staff that were uninterested at what they were doing and their indifference discouraged you from the moment you set foot in their offices. They acted as if they were too full to care for attracting additional renters even though most of them had several vacant apartments. Moreover many of the apartments did not have a 6 month lease and those that did raised the lease by more than 100 dollars which was really unfair. But when I came to Lodge at Southpoint I was really surprised. Kailea addressed all my concerns regarding bugs, cleanliness of the apartment, lighting, etc . She showed me the apartment on two different occasions to help me decide if it was suitable. As I have recently entered the states I was unfamiliar with electricity and insurance arrangements and she patiently explained everything to me. I wanted to look at rentals in other areas (downtown and north durham) before deciding to sign the lease but as they had only one vacant 1-bedroom apartment left I was afraid that someone else might show interest in the same unit while I was searching. So I went there the next day to see what I could do, and again Kailea was very helpful. She said after filling the application and paying the administrative fee, application fee and safety deposit, I will have 48 hours to cancel the application and will only lose the application fee. This really helped me. She also reduced the administrative fee to half by putting me in their preferred employers list. I wouldn't have known about the possibility of such a discount if it wasn't for her honest services. I was so pleased with the apartment and their service that when I filled the application and came out of the office I knew I wouldn't need to search more. And I believe if the company is smart enough to put someone like Kailea in charge of leasing, they will continue to amaze me with their apartment and service.

Report
Resident
2014 - 2015 Recommended Property Reviewed 06/13/2015
We've lived here for a little over 6 months, and you can't beat the location, as it's right off I-40, and surrounded by shopping, restaurants, and a walking trail. The property is maintained very well, and office and maintenance staff are very friendly and responsive. The property calls itself a luxury property, but really needs updating and actual luxury amenities. The appliances are old and do not work very well, and we've had the refrigerator and dishwasher serviced and they still do not work. The hot water doesn't always work and we've had problems with water pressure. The walls are thin, and we do hear our neighbors, however it's not terrible. Overall, it's a very quiet and safe neighborhood.

Leasing Staff and Resident manager are by far the friendliest and most helpful I have encountered at any of the properties in North Carolina that I've lived at. Maintenance is on point, I have had zero issues with the apartment. Pricing is great for the area and location is first rate to all the local conveniences. The grounds are well maintained and beautiful. Resident
2015 Recommended Property Reviewed 05/02/2015
I am a professional working in RTP and compared numerous apartments in the area before selecting the Lodge at Southpoint. Overall, I am extremely pleased I chose this apartment comlex for the following reasons: 1) Outstanding location relative to shopping, can walk to the Streets at Southpoint mall and the Super Target is across the street with other shops and restaurants. 2) I work out regularly and the apartment has a very nice gym, pool, and mountain bikes, and is located adjacent to the American Tobacco Trail, ideal for running and biking. 3) The staff is very professional and efficient, especially the maintenance staff. After moving in, I reported a couple of minor issues that were addressed immediately. 4) There is ample parking and the units and grounds are maintained very professionally. In summary, I highly recommend the Lodge at Southpoint, and all my wonderful neighbors agree.

Resident
2011 - 2015 Recommended Property Reviewed 04/05/2015
The apartment itself and the complex are very nice. We've had 2 units and this 3 bedroom is laid out much better than our previous 2 bedrom. Having come from a large home, this feels very spacious. There are lots of nice features, unfortunately though the kitchen is smaller in this unit (particularly storage wise) than the 2 bedrooms. Fortunately there are other places to store things if you're creative. The complex is very dog friendly and very convenient to walk, take a bus or drive. For the first couple of years here the office was poorly run and some of the people were downright rude. More recently there seems to be a true emphasis on training and customer care, a very welcome change. This applies for at least a year - the same with the maintenance people - the current crew is much better in their skills. I wish some of the common areas - particularly pool and gym were a bit larger but otherwise we are very happy here. The sound depends on the people. We've had several neighbors above us and most we rarely if ever heard, for some reason now we hear a lot, I think it's more how the move and what they do than the construction. Although our rent is increasing more than we'd like, we plan to stay, it feels like home at least for another year or two.

Resident
2014 Recommended Property Reviewed 10/29/2014
I have been living in the area for over 10 years and lived in many other apartments. This apartment is about 10 years old. It does not feature state of the art amenities like new apts, but it is well maintained and have everything that is needed. Residents are mostly young working professionals, which makes it very quite neighborhood unlike some student apartment. I had no problem with noise in my first month of living here. Maintenance is very good. You get your problems resolved on the day you submit a work order. Location can be considered superb because it is across from southpoint mall, you can walk to theater, super target, aldi. You have tobacco road trail running through middle of the apartment complex, which is great for walking or biking. easy access to I-40 makes it always good. 800 bus stop is right in front of the apartment, which makes it good for UNC employee or student. leasing office amenities have most of the things you need, but some of the amenities seem to be old and need to be replaced since it is 10 years old. I was surprised that in order to use some amenities you need to go through office staff and pay security deposit. For leasing company, it is better to be safe and prevent something from missing, but it is hassle for the resident. I think it kind of tells the safety of apartment complex is not most ideal environment. I think office staff tries to hold community event maybe once a month or two. I never been to those yet, so cannot comment on that. Considering Apartment is 10 years old, I personally think rent should be little lower, but it was not ridiculously over-priced. This apartment make you pay $25 mandatory trash service fee, which seems to be little over priced. There were No bugs or roaches found, which is always good and evidence of how well apartment is kept. Overall, This is pleasant place to live and would recommend it to people who read this review.

Report
Resident
2013 - 2014 Recommended Property Reviewed 05/14/2014
Good things: The office staff is always friendly. We ran into someone from the office at a nearby business and they greeted us by name. We pick up packages at least every few weeks and they're always friendly. (Having to pick up packages at the office is fairly inconvenient, though.) Maintenance staff responds extremely quickly, even on weekends if it's urgent, and are always friendly and seem knowledgeable. Grounds and buildings are mostly well-kept and clean, except for some people who occasionally don't clean up after their dogs. There is plenty of parking, all nearby each building. If you're into jogging or biking, the American Tobacco Trail is right next to the eastern half of the complex. There are many stores and restaurants very close by. It's convenient to the highway and RTP. Bad things: We have had to make several maintenance requests in the one year we've lived here. We've called in the same problem with our fridge four times and it is still not fixed, even though they've spent hours taking apart our fridge and replacing parts. Our air conditioning has never worked well, and now it is completely nonfunctional, and they brush off our complaints saying they can't do anything about it unless it meets specific guidelines. The walls are very thin. We have neighbors on all four sides and across the hall, and although I wouldn't consider them loud neighbors (no loud music or movies, no shouting, no stomping, no loud kids) we can hear them all the time. Our bedroom shares a wall with the kitchen next door, and we can hear them talking even if they're not speaking loudly. Overall: The apartment seems great at first, but the annoyances outweigh the appearance. I don't know how it compares to other complexes in the area. It's alright for a short period of time, but I would not want to live here indefinitely.

2011 - 2012 Recommended Property Reviewed 06/30/2012
As apartments go this place rates a solid 3.5 to 4. It looks nice and the exteriors are in good shape. Always quite and in a very good location for access to I-40 and shopping. A Super Target is across the street with cheap groceries. As other reviews mentioned the appliances are very cheap, especially the stove. Never could get the burners level enough to use properly. But the upside is there is a full size washer and dryer in each. (I look at competitors and they didn't have them, one didn't even have a microwave.) Parking is good, always found a space. Workout area is okay though they don't make it a priority for upkeep. Staff has been very good, had an after hours Sunday water leak from above and they were out within an hour. One negative is they get to bill you for water and the cost is high. Expect to pay $50 / month.

Resident
2010 Not Recommended Reviewed 02/08/2012
I vowed to myself that if it was the last thing I did, I would write a review of this place after a downright harrowing experience there for the 3 months I endured living at the Lodge before getting out of there. Don't be fooled by the gorgeous exterior and the proximity to South Point and shoppes on Renaissance parkway; you can live in a castle, but if it's mismanaged and you're the one to suffer, then you're better off living in a trough where people treat you fairly. Relatively speaking- the minor problems we dealt with were extremely poor insulation in the walls (good luck to you if you live on the 2nd floor-- you'll hear what sounds elephants upstairs, and your neighbors downstairs are sure to complain about your footsteps as you're waking around your own apartment), broken appliances which took days to fix, a dog park that is used as a a wasteland for dog excrement (and never cleaned, mind you!), the apartment painted the wrong color from what we specified, 3 weeks to get a mailbox key after 4 requests, and an office staff who NEVER answers their phones. Honestly, about 8% of the calls ever went through to a live person, and about 40% of calls were ever returned. Now for the major events that led to our prompt exit: 1. we were harassed by a neighbor downstairs who would smack our ceiling and the pipes outside our balcony with what sounded like a golf club. If we did laundry- BANG, if we turned on the dishwasher- BANG, if we walked around to get food from the kitchen- BANG. Finally, as respectful people would, we knocked on his door below to inquire about what all the banging was, and he promptly screamed and slammed the door in our faces, shaking the entire floor. He claimed that our young puppy (mostly at dog day care and often boarded for fear of her safety after our neighbor's outbursts) was tromping around and keeping him up. Our dog weighed all of 18 lbs, and was never home-- when we were both working, he claimed that there was running around upstairs (no one, not even the dog was home), and basically threatened us having a dog on the premises- something welcomed and even encouraged by the Lodge staff. After all, there IS a dog park. After the screaming and door slamming, we felt unsafe living in the Lodge- we literally walked on tiptoes and would run outside to see if our neighbor's car was in the lot before deciding to do laundry. We would waste time outside of the apartment to ensure that we could home late enough to put the dog and ourselves right to bed so as not to "agitate" our neighbor. It was a nightmare. As any concerned tenant would, we appealed to the office staff, and expressed our concern. We felt for our safety, and were simply told that "said tenant has lived here for 3 years and has never complained about anyone else." And that we shouldn't feel unsafe as a police officer lives on the premises. We tried to seek out all options- including moving units, but all they could accommodate us with was a downgrade (for the same price) with our front door facing a busy street in the "annex" portion of the Lodge. We were already paying more money for being on the 2nd floor with a beautiful pool view and they felt that then moving across to the annex, on the first floor, to a smaller unit, and view of the swamp, should result in the same monthly fee. This was not an option for us. Since the Lodge did nothing to acknowledge our position and the fact that their lease is supposed to protect a tenant from threatening environments, they did nothing. Their interpretation of their lease is that it is to protect THEM, the establishment. This is a direct quote. We had countless meetings with the office staff (most of whom are lazy, and would rather ride around on the company golf cart and talk on cell phones than address clients), and then had to wait a week to talk to a manage, who is not even on site. This "higher-up" came to meet us, made us wait 40 mins, and then told us we could break the lease for an excess of 3k plus our monthly 1100k rent until the place was released. I couldn't believe this-- we weren't even there 3 months, and had been through hell and they wouldn't work with us. Even longer story short, they confiscated $400.00 of our pet deposit despite the dog always being boarded for fear of the neighbor, our application fee, and charged us rent until the apartment was rented a few months later. What is worst of all, is that in order for us to discover the apartment had been rented, (and subsequently them ceasing to receive our money for a vacant apartment), I drove by one night and saw lights were on in our old place. Never did they call to say the place was re-rented; I had to broach the subject and explain to them that by law they were to cease taking payment from us once the place was re-rented. To this day, we don't know how long the place was rented for before we figured it out. It's a true shame that a place with such potential can be be destroyed by incompetency on the part of staff and management. We spend thousands living there, moving in, and then moving out. We had to pay 2 deposits, pet fees, moving truck fees, etc... and all for nothing. If you decide to have a go at living here, I wish you luck... should you have no problem and never cross paths with management, you're golden; should you need their services, you're luckier drawing blood from a stone.
I vowed to myself that if it was the last thing I did, I would write a review of this place after a downright harrowing experience there for the 3 months I endured living at the Lodge before getting out of there. Don't be fooled by the gorgeous exterior and the proximity to South Point and shoppes on Renaissance parkway; you can live in a castle, but if it's mismanaged and you're the one to suffer, then you're better off living in a trough where people treat you fairly. Relatively speaking- the minor problems we dealt with were extremely poor insulation in the walls (good luck to you if you live on the 2nd floor-- you'll hear what sounds elephants upstairs, and your neighbors downstairs are sure to complain about your footsteps as you're waking around your own apartment), broken appliances which took days to fix, a dog park that is used as a a wasteland for dog excrement (and never cleaned, mind you!), the apartment painted the wrong color from what we specified, 3 weeks to get a mailbox key after 4 requests, and an office staff who NEVER answers their phones. Honestly, about 8% of the calls ever went through to a live person, and about 40% of calls were ever returned. Now for the major events that led to our prompt exit: 1. we were harassed by a neighbor downstairs who would smack our ceiling and the pipes outside our balcony with what sounded like a golf club. Resident
2010 - 2011 Not Recommended Reviewed 08/16/2011
I have lived at The Lodge At Southpoint for almost a year and am moving out when my contract expires due to extreme rent increases and various problems through the year. 1. Appliances - during a 12 month period my washer, dryer, dishwasher, and air conditioner have all broken. The maintenance men come the next day and fix it (except the air conditioner which has broke several times this summer) and they are very friendly. My biggest complaint is that the appliance are poor quality and if it breaks during the night they make you feel a bit guilty for calling the maintenance line. 2. Office Hours and staff - The office hours are terrible if you have a job. They are open from 8:30-5:30 during the week so you can never go in and talk to them and on Saturdays and Sundays are busy giving tours and never around or there are a million people waiting. 3. Packages - come to the office instead of the mail kiosk, but you can't get them because the office closes at 5:30 so you have to wait until Saturday or Sunday if you want to get your package. 4. The garbage area is NASTY - it is always overflowing and a serious health hazard. I have considered calling Environmental Health Services on several occasions. 5. The green areas are covered with dog poop and occasionally litter. It is a pet friendly community (and I have a dog) but most owners aren't respectful and do not clean up after their pets. 6. The sprinkler system does not water the grass but instead waters the sidewalk and sand volleyball and parking lot. After complaining to the manager that our money was being wasted she said that the funds are from elsewhere and that "it isn't a big deal" - but not being able to get to your door without getting soaked is actually a "big deal" 7. The office staff (except Stacy) are generally very negative and unfriendly. They are short to speak when answering questions and do not create a welcoming environment for the residents. 8. The rent is going up astronomically. My rent increase this year to renew my lease was an extra $250 a month. In this economy nobody is getting a $250 a month pay increase and even if I was, I certainly wouldn't spend it to stay at this place.

Resident
2011 Recommended Property Reviewed 06/29/2011
My wife and I have been renting a 1 bedroom apartment here for about one year and overall we've been pleased with our experience. My initial impression of the staff was somewhat negative, but I feel that it has improved the longer I've lived here. It can be hard to get a hold of them on the phone, so I always bring my issues to them in person or online. The complex is well-maintained for the most part, with the exception of the garbage disposal/recycling center. Oftentimes the garbage compactor is overflowing (or even missing!), so the residents choose to just pile their garbage on the ground. The area is designed in such a way where I have to climb over the piles of trash in order to be a good citizen and get my trash where it belongs. There was a span of about a month when they failed to have recycling picked up and the office staff (several of which who live here) seemed to be oblivious to the situation. That has since been resolved (for now). The biggest complaint about our actual unit is that it is not soundproofed well enough. We have a neighbor who blares his home theater at odd hours of the night and we have had to ask him to keep the volume down on a couple of occasions. On one particular visit at 4am, he explained to me that all he had been doing was folding his laundry. And I believe him! The ceiling between our bedrooms must be very thin. Sleeping with earplugs helps, but if it's at all possible, get a top-floor unit. We have a nice view of a small pond from our sizable porch. There are actually several wetlands on the property which makes for some nice birdwatching if you're into that sort of thing. We had several issues with our dryer, but after several attempts to fix it, they brought us a brand new one. We also had an ordeal with the dishwasher which was eventually resolved after approximately 3 weeks and 8 visits. The location really can't be beat. We are frequently walking to Target, Tomato Jake's (weekly trivia, NFL Sunday Ticket), and Southpoint Mall. I also like being close to the American Tobacco Trail-- although the folks at the Lodge should really find a way to make it more accessible to it's residents. As it is, I have to walk through the adjacent neighborhood to get to it. Eventually, the trail is supposed to run directly through the complex, though.

2010 - 2011 Recommended Property Reviewed 05/24/2011
I have lived at several apartment complexes in the Raleigh/Durham area since 2005 and The Lodge at Southpoint is by far the best! I unfortunately have to move due to a family circumstance but otherwise I wouldn't have lived anywhere else but here. From the time I signed by lease to the time I informed the management staff of my departure, they were nothing but professional, friendly, and welcoming. The rent is competitive (if not less expensive) than other communities in the area and the quality for the price is exceptional. Upon move in, I was offered a choice of color for my free kitchen accent wall painting. The inside of the apartment is great, especially the huge garden tub. The included washer/dryer is a huge plus. I've needed to call maintenance only a couple of times for minor repairs but each time, they responded quickly and were extremely professional. The management staff, despite having numerous tenants, always remembered my name, asked about my family, etc. I've never had any problems with security and because the area is well-lit, I always felt very comfortable walking my dog in the very early or late hours of the day and night. Overall, I can't say enough about this great community!

I was a little surprised to see some of the negative reviews on this website! My husband and I lived at The Lodge at Southpoint from February 2010-February 2011. The only reason we moved was because we took a huge step and bought a new home in the Durham area only five minutes away from this choice location. The reasons why this apartment community is fantastic cannot be enumerated with enough emphasis: The landscaping is beautiful, especially in the spring. I loved being able to drive into the community and see lush, carefully pruned shrubbery and blooming trees because it gave it more of an escape feel than other properties might have. I rarely saw garbage on the ground (although there were a few pieces here and there at times, especially on weekends when maintenance might not be working). The Lodge offers a full convey of amenities of which I took advantage on a regular basis. The gym is a great size and very open with all the equipment you need and three larger sized, flat screen televisions. The swimming pool is beautiful and kept up very nicely with grills out beside it. Bikes are available to rent (I only used these once) and there's a movie theatre inside with space for a meet-up. If that's not enough to convince you, you'll catch Kenya and the rest of the staff preparing brunch on Saturday mornings at least once a month! I never got to attend due to a very busy schedule, but I hear they're great! The inside of the apartments are very spacious and carefully turned for a clean, hassle-freee move-in. My husband and I especially enjoyed the double vanities in the master bathroom. The closets are HUGE! And many of the apartments have upgraded carpeting which give the apartments a higher-end feel. The girls in the front office (Kenya, Ashley, and Stacy) did a fantastic job of communicating any work requests we had (we only put in two over the course of our lease). Maintenance always came right away and was very friendly when we were in the apartment. The only thing I would have liked to see different was maybe a little more involvement from upper management - just because I would have liked to put a name with a face. However, I understand that The Lodge is a big, busy property! Perhaps the best thing about living at The Lodge was our neighbors! People here are so friendly, and we met four of our very best friends at this property! Lastly - people complaining about safety/security need to realize that you are responsible for your own safety. Crime does not have an address, and I would venture to say that the majority of people who have experienced break-ins have left a GPS/computer/phone/cord/something that looks similar in plain sight. You've got to be proactive and protect yourself wherever you may live! A for my experience here.

TheLodgeSouthpoint 11/30/2010

Hi, we do realize that your post was marked anonymous but we would like to address some of your concerns with the property. As far as the grounds, we do ask that each resident that has a pet pick up after their pet. As you stated, this policy is not always adhered to. If there is a troublesome area on the property, please stop by the office and tell us about it so that we may have someone attend to it quickly and frequently. As for our screening criteria, we conduct a thorough search of prior rental history, income, and a complete criminal background check before allowing any person to become a resident. We are sorry if you do not like your neighbors, however our criteria, which is based off of Fair Housing and Equal Housing Opportunity laws, allows any and every person that qualifies based on those standards an opportunity to call The Lodge home. Perhaps you would like to attend the upcoming Holiday party December 14th and meet some of the neighbors that live throughout the property. We're sure you'd find someone you'd enjoy talking to as we have residents from every walk of life at this community. Thanks and we hope you will allow us the opportunity to overcome some of your objections to the community. The Lodge at Southpoint Management Team

Resident
2000 - 2001 Recommended Property Reviewed 02/24/2010
I lived here as a traveller in early 2000, and it was beautiful! I had two labrador retrievers with me, and the complex was very accomodating. I loved the berber carpet, and the garden tubs...the apartment was brand new when I moved in. I thought the layout was great as well! I heard NO noise...but I may not have had neighbors yet. I was there before the mall was built, and before Target; it was lovely and an easy ride to Jordon Lake, where I took my labs frequently. Very convenient to I-40. Nice gas station right around the corner. My apartment NEVER smelled of dogs; thanks to low pile berber carpet and frequent vacuuming. I do remember hearing something about a car being broken into just before I was getting ready to leave; the mall had just opened. I am really sad to hear how downhill this place has gone...why would management even choose to rent to undergraduates, and not enforce rules? Keeping the standards high is the only way to ensure getting quality renters. My only complaints while living there were that I never used the pool, because there were snakes and tree frogs in it every time I checked it out, and the trash dumpster was a hike...they could definitely have used more of those. Other than that, what few neighbors I had seemed to be very responsible- even to the point of washing their dogs feet before entering the apartment after walks! I personally left my apartment in IMPECCABLE condition, despite having lived there with two big dogs, and as far as I know, my company received my full deposit back. If Management is reading this, WAKE UP and lay down the law! Your responsible renters (the ones worth keeping) will appreciate it! Keep in mind that my ratings are based only on my personal experience, of having lived in the community when it was brand new.

Report
Resident
2007 - 2008 Not Recommended Reviewed 06/24/2008
If you're an undergrad with undergrad tendencies to drink and party, then The Lodge is the place for you. However, if you're a young professional looking for a nice, quiet, convenient place to call home then you may want to look elsewhere. Within the last few months the number of 'students' living here has swelled. Along with the increase in their numbers, there has been an increase in noise throughout the community. For example the other night someone hosted a pool party. The noise could be heard at buildings well distant from the pool. While the staff advertises the presence of a courtesy officer, no such intervention tamed this party. There are also other instances of students screaming and chasing each other in the parking lot, hosting drinking games on their balcony, and just be obnoxious neighbors. Don't get me wrong: I'm not anti-student. However, when you move into a community that doesn't cater to students, then months later the face of the community suddenly changes and along with it the quiet setting, you begin to think it's time to move. Don't count on the property manager to intervene. She's completely content barricading herself in her office, and don't hold your breath that she'll return your call on any matters you'd like to discuss with her. Apparently, as long as the rent checks keep coming, it matters not the quality of life of ALL the residents.

Within the last few months the number of 'students' living here has swelled. Along with the increase in their numbers, there has been an increase in noise throughout the community. For example the other night someone hosted a pool party. The noise could be heard at buildings well distant from the pool. While the staff advertises the presence of a courtesy officer, no such intervention tamed this party. There are also other instances of students screaming and chasing each other in the parking lot, hosting drinking games on their balcony, and just be obnoxious neighbors. Don't get me wrong: I'm not anti-student. However, when you move into a community that doesn't cater to students, then months later the face of the community suddenly changes and along with it the quiet setting, you begin to think it's time to move. Don't count on the property manager to intervene. She's completely content barricading herself in her office, and don't hold your breath that she'll return your call on any matters you'd like to discuss with her. Apparently, as long as the rent checks keep coming, it matters not the quality of life of ALL the residents. Read less

2007 Not Recommended Reviewed 12/04/2007
The Lodge is a nice place, right across the street from the mall, Target, and many restaurants; however, location is the only thing this complex has. When I first took a tour, I was showed all the nice things the apartment had to offer, theater, much parking, nice place. I then moved in to find that I could not use any of it. The manager told me "the theater is mainly to give tours in. You cannot watch a movie here during the day." Also, pets are allowed. I love animals, but only when they are controlled. Getting the front office to enforce their animal rules is like trying to find water in the Sahara, it just doesn't happen. If you plan on sleeping at night, or even watching a football game without dog noise, this complex is not for you. No car wash, the only outdoor hose has a padlock on it. Also, the ONE garbage dumpster is constantly overflowing. Overall, spending the extra hundred dollars a month to buy a house or condo is a much better choice. This complex was poorly planned, and despite its appearance, falls short of satisfaction.

Resident
2006 - 2007 Recommended Property Reviewed 03/28/2007
I've been very pleased living here. I moved in with a crisis--water damage in the bathroom and a rust-leaking air conditioning unit. The office and maintenance staff responded immediately; the air-conditioner issue recurred a few times and each time, maintenance staff came to fix the problem immediately. Since then, no problems at all.<br><br>Apartments are very well-configured, and more practically organized than many I've seen. All of my appliances have been in good working order and relatively new. The buildings are well-maintained and in good condition. The grounds are similarly well-cared-for: landscaping, maintenance, etc. Some of the parking areas were deteriorating but all of the roads and lots in the complex received a new top-coat and any damage was repaired.<br><br>The office is informative about neighborhood issues. Although safety is not a high concern, they nevertheless inform community members if there have been any incidents. They also provide advanced notice of repairs within the community. I've found the office staff friendly and helpful. The community is diverse and comfortable--I'm particularly struck by how many families live here.<br><br>The location of the Lodge has been very convenient--just off of I-40, easy shopping for all of my daily needs, it makes daily life very easy.<br><br>With respect to noise, the apartments are generally pretty good. I've never had any problems with hearing neighbors' voices. Upstairs footsteps are occasionally a problem if the person walks heavily. Dogs ARE allowed in the complex, and so there is the potential for noise there, but I'm surrounded by a large number of well-behaved dogs.<br><br>Overall I have been delighted to live here and am looking forward to renewing my lease for the coming year.

2005 - 2006 Recommended Property Reviewed 01/14/2007
I lived in the Lodge for 14 months and moved out only because of a split with my roommate. A large two bedroom at the lodge can be a bit pricey compared to a one bedroom elsewhere, but I loved it there and still haven't found a place I think I'll be as comfortable at..<br><br>Here's what I've come to appreciate about the Lodge after looking elsewhere:<br><br>1) The Location near Southpoint Mall provides an urban-like setting I don't see elsewhere.<br><br>2) The Location provides extremely quick and easy access to I-40 making commutes shorter and easier.<br><br>3) Ample parking. I never realized how good it was until I started driving through other complexes at 11PM to see how full they are. This is something important that I really overlooked while at the Lodge.<br><br>4) Generous parking lighting. Always felt safe at night.<br><br>5) Textured wall paint hides imperfections and looks good.<br><br>6) Berber carpet hides wear areas and makes the carpet look uniformly good and resist wear.<br><br>7) Large bathrooms. They're like good hotel size bathrooms. I miss them! Plenty of cabinet space, too!<br><br>8) Spacious apartments. Our two bedroom felt really big partly due to a nice layout and partly because it was just *a lot of space*.<br><br>9) Open, stable (concrete) and well-light stairs between apartments.<br><br>10) Resort style pool. It's made to look and feel like a hotel which makes relaxing at it very enjoyable.<br><br>11) The Office staff was very helpful with me -- even on several occasions after I moved out.<br><br>12) Plenty of cabinet area in kitchens.<br><br>13) Tenants (that I noticed) are quiet, affluent professionals. My building was extremely quiet minus one set of students whose music was only a problem 2-3 times in 14 months.<br><br>14) Despite warnings of problems around christmas due to shoppers at the stores, we didn't experience much and the convenience to stores made up for increased traffic.<br><br>15) The apartments are fairly new -- 3-4 years old. You overlook this until you visist a few 20 year old apartments with really poor cabinets, appliances, etc.<br><br>The Lodge was my first apartment living ever so until I moved out I didn't have much to compare it to. Now that I'm looking at other complexes, I'm seeing the differences. Older appliances, patched walls, odd layouts and short ceilings, porches screened because of mosquitos from nearby swamps, etc. No problems like these at the Lodge.<br><br>The only things keeping me from moving back to the lodge is the price for a single person and the desire to try something new.

This is a fabulous place to live for young professionals. Although located very near Duke University and UNC-CH, the only college students that this complex houses are quiet grad students. The prices are a little out of normal, partying, college student range. So - what you're going to get is a nice, quiet, young professional crowd. The apartments are brand new - fresh paint, fresh carpet - all with that "new apartment" smell. And - you get to choose the color of your kitchen before moving in! They'll paint it the color of your choice! And talk about LOCATION - Target, Petco, Michael's, Tomato Jakes Pizzeria - all right across the street. Walk about 100 yards down the NICE sidewalk and you'll be at The Street @ Southpoint Mall. My roommates and I walk to the bars at Champs and The Cheesecake Factory and then walk back - no designated driver needed! Everything is at your fingertips.<br><br>So - if you're looking for the newest and most upcoming place to live in this area - go for this complex. You can't beat it.
This is a fabulous place to live for young professionals. Although located very near Duke University and UNC-CH, the only college students that this complex houses are quiet grad students. The prices are a little out of normal, partying, college student range. So - what you're going to get is a nice, quiet, young professional crowd. The apartments are brand new - fresh paint, fresh carpet - all with that "new apartment" smell. And - you get to choose the color of your kitchen before moving in! They'll paint it the color of your choice! And talk about LOCATION - Target, Petco, Michael's, Tomato Jakes Pizzeria - all right across the street. Walk about 100 yards down the NICE sidewalk and you'll be at The Street @ Southpoint Mall. My roommates and I walk to the bars at Champs and The Cheesecake Factory and then walk back - no designated driver needed! Everything is at your fingertips.<br><br>So - if you're looking for the newest and most upcoming place to live in this area - go for this complex. You can't beat it. Read less

2004 - 2005 Not Recommended Reviewed 12/11/2005
I said that I would check in -<br><br>So, six months later and I have recently renewed my lease. I pay ~$790 for a one bedroom which is up around 5% from my previous rent. Also, during my renegotiation, I was made painfully aware that would be no negotiation. Either pay more or leave is basically how that goes.<br><br>The new Super Target and related shopping complex has opened up right across the street. Really nice having all those amenities in literal walking distance. Can't wait till Tomatoes Joe's pizzeria (owner is a resident in The Lodge) opens up in a few weeks. There have not been too many difficulties from the new store except for some increased traffic on the main road. But overall, I am pleased with the new development with regards to the increased convenience.<br><br>The staff of the complex has had significant amounts of turnover. However, there is a core group that remains which is helpful since its nice to have people who recognize and know you. But, like my last message, they still never really try to go up and beyond the call of duty. I have had some interaction with the maintenance staff and have found them to be fairly helpful and professional in their job. They have gotten to my issues in a reasonable timeframe and do well to fix the problems. <br><br>Security has been a huge problems in the recent months. Two apartments were robbed over the Thanksgiving break. There was also an assault of a women - but details on that are more fuzzy. The apartment always sends out a flyer with an alert when something happens in the community. However, one of their recent messages said, "The Lodge is NOT responsible for your safety or personal well-being". That basically sums up The Lodge's attitude to its community. It is true that we are responsible for our safety but it would be nice to know that someone is also looking out for our best interest. I recently asked the property manager if they were considering gating the community due to safety concerns. She flatly said "NO"! I followed-up asking if their we any additional security features they were adding given the new shopping development across the street. She again responded "NO"!<br><br>DOGS! The lodge has finally accomplished its goal of making the dog park completely unusable. After months of resident complaints asking The Lodge to plant more grass in the area, they responded by cutting the area of the park in half and dumping tons of gravel over the remaining portion of the park. The gravel can cut the feet of the dogs and is very unpleasant to walk on. Additionally the gates have been broken for many months now and dogs can easily get out of the fenced area. The pet situation has been a contentious on for the community as some residence don't pick up after their animals which other let their pet off the leash. But, The Lodge has done little to police this and is not very innovative in dealing with the problem. Instead, they just threaten dog owners and take no responsibility for the issues.<br><br>From my perspective, parking has been good, the existing amenities are well kept since my last message (although they should have towels in the workout room - kind of disgusting since no one wipes off the equipment), the landscaping has been good for the most part. <br><br>Conclusion: The Lodge is a really nice place to live but the residents have to keep on the apartment managers and drive responsibility for issues no matter how much they want to say, "THE Lodge is not responsible for ...". (Take a look at the sign on the dog park for an example).<br><br>Well - I am moving in a couple of months but will be sure to update you before then.

Resident
2005 Recommended Property Reviewed 11/13/2005
I've been living at the Lodge for about 1 year now and I've been pretty satisfied. The apartments are very new and clean, and the community is filled with great amenities. Management has been fairly responsive, though it sometimes takes a couple of days for work orders to be filled. I havent had any issues with neighbors - I actually never hear anyone moving around. Though some have complained about parking, I find that it's not too difficult to find. My only complaints are that the community is not gated, and the small-ish business center is closed after hours. Also, the apartments are pretty expensive (and management locks you in with a low rate and then jacks up the price after the year-long specials expire). But since I share my apartment, I can afford quite a bit more than if I lived alone.

I lived at Southpoint for 18 months. In the beginning it was fine. Over the last year the security has been horrible. I've had 2 flat tires, had to call the police due to noise several times, and I have felt very uneasy with the community traffic coming in and out of the pool and rec area. Most of the people in the work out room and pool get off the bus-line and come in to join those of us who pay high dollar to live there. I was living in their smallest 1 bedroom apartment and was paying the same amount as many of the 2 bedroom tenants at newer complexes in Cary and Raleigh. It is listed as dog friendly, but what that really means is that the owners w/o dogs suffer through the noise and smell of unkept grass areas.

Resident
2004 - 2005 Not Recommended Reviewed 04/13/2005
When we first moved in here, everything seemed perfect. However, the quality of life has consistently declined in the latter months. Parking is scarce, the dog park, though it's great to have is not well maintained, and the office staff is overall not too friendly and helpful. <br><br>Often, I have to park far away from my apartment. One of my friends was forced to park in a handicapped space one night and was then given a $40 ticket by the courtesy officer. Another friend was forced to park on the curb and then had his car towed for $250. <br><br>Like I said, the dog park is great, but the canisters for the waste are not well maintained; last week they were overflowing with poop. While there is a problem with people not picking up their dogs' waste, some of that problem stems from the lack of bags provided near the canisters. <br><br>Mike is by far the friendliest person on the office staff; he has always been friendly and helpful. The maintenance guys are great as well. However, some members of the office staff are completely rude and usually have a challenging attitude. Customer service is not their strength, to say the least. One of them once asked me "What's the problem here?" in a snide manner. While they are nice enough to convince you to move in, they definitely do not try to keep tenants here after their leases run out; in fact, they raise the rent far beyond the market values.<br><br>With Target and Michaels coming next year, the traffic will become even worse than it is now. If you plan on moving in here in the next few months, beware of the construction, the trucks, and the noise. <br><br>With all this being said, I must say that the other tenants here are very considerate and personable and this is still a far nicer apartment community than most others in this area.

Note: the previous comment from LauraE03 was written by someone in The Lodge Office. *Be careful about reviews that have glowing remarks followed by one "minor" complaint. Here is the scoop on the Lodge at Southpoint.<br><br>As of 03/14/05, the Lodge has been raising the rent on its current tenants around $300-$500 for both one and two bedroom apartments. This has caused at least three tenants that I know to leave after their leases were up. Management was not sympathetic to keeping their current tenant for renewals. Mind you, these tenants were already paying $750 (one bedroom) and $1050 (two bedroom). (Not sure about the third one tenant)<br><br>The constuction across the street is hard to take with lots of noise and the traffic is getting worse with the large mall across the street. This community will not be as nice when the Target opens across the street with the increased traffic and amount of people in the area. Also, there were lots of car break-ins early March 2005 which might get worse with increased traffic from Targets shopping center. The apartment should create a gated community to assist with these issues but management is fairly cheap in making improvements like this.<br><br>The amenties look great when you sign your lease but you will find that managment does not up keep these well - pool table has no cue sticks, volleyball court net has been broken for a year, barbeques are never cleaned (we'll see about the new one in the pool area), dog park is never cared for by staff after frequent request from tenants and the work-out room has no towels which sometimes makes the equiptment not so nice to use. Putting green has not been mowed in last 6 months (since October). The waste disposal areas are not well lit and often are not well kept.<br><br>The service staff is OK - they promptly fixed the few issues I have had with plumbing and doors sticking. The tenants are nice (although management is doing their best to get rid of everyone with higher rents)! People are not picking up after their dogs which is a really bad problem - management addressed the issue by writing a letter to tenants but I have not seen any major enforcment of the policy.<br><br>Parking is not an issue except around Christmas time when people visiting the Southpoint mall decide to park in the apartment parking lots. (again - new Target store might cause some problems). They do sometimes have community events in the clubhouse which are nice but not always well run by staff.<br><br>Overall, a good place to live but be weary about the increasing rent and the amentities. I do like the style of apartments and the general location close to both Duke, UNC and the research triangle park. The management does well to get you to sign the lease but you might find that they poorly manage the property after you move in. <br><br>Good luck in your apartment search!

2004 - 2005 Recommended Property Reviewed 03/07/2005
This is a wonderful community. If I weren't moving into a house I would have definately renewed. For the amount of ammenities, the price is really a steal. The convenience of your own washer and dryer in the unit, a gorgeous resort style swimming pool, a great dog park, a very fun club house and movie theater and the location (less then a mile from anything you could possibly need) I couldnt imagine paying any less. Thank you to all the folks at the Lodge for providing with a wonderful living environment for the past year. I will always recommend this community to anyone that passes my way.

Resident
2003 - 2004 Not Recommended Reviewed 06/08/2004
I lived in a one bedroom here for a year, and while the apartments themselves are very nice, almost everything else about the place is terrible. As of this review, many of the things mentioned before still apply (dog poop, lousy office help, noise, etc). Here are some things not yet covered: <br> <br>Parking - while some of the apartments have plenty, I noticed on the map that about half of them have insufficient parking. If you decide to live here, pick apartments in phase II or away from the office. <br> <br>Air conditioning - I talked to a few neighbors, and they agreed that these AC units are very, very loud. Loud enough that you can't hear the TV in the living room when it's on. It took some getting used to sleep-wise. <br> <br>Bugs - this place has several protected wetlands scattered around, so you can forget about your patio if your place is near them. A clean patio, in warm weather, is covered in dead bugs within a week. You can also see large mosquitoes everywhere. Spiders and spider crickets also have a tendency to make their way into the apartment as well. <br> <br>Noise - A certain amount of noise upstairs is tolerable, but not when your neighbors up there have thunderous footsteps. I thought it was because they were large people, but my other 1st floor neighbors had similar complaints. I've also heard my neighbors snoring and turning over in bed. I can also hear people talking in the apartments adjacent to mine. <br> <br>AC drainage - A maintenance worker told me this is a common problem. The pipe that usually carries out AC drainage water often gets clogged, so the water eventually fills up a pan and overflows out the backup pipe. The only problem is that pipe drains directly into your bathtub from overhead, staining your garden tub orange, and causing pink mold to grow everywhere. I've had it fixed 4 times, and every time, it starts flowing out that pipe again after a week or so. <br> <br>Office spaces - the corner offices built into the apartments seem nice, but they're cramped if you have a regular office chair and if you're tall like me. <br> <br>Location/layout - don't get a place right up near the road. The noise of passing cars, and passing people on the walkway is very noticeable, no matter what they tell you. Also, it seems kind of strange to me to have the bathroom (while it is a nice bathroom), have two exits into your bedroom and kitchen. <br> <br>Coincidentally, the manager of the new apartments I'm moving to used to work here, and she said things went to pieces after the apartments were sold, so she left. <br> <br>The office people just aren't very friendly. No problems with packages or rent checks, but they always seem like "What do you want now?" (I went in maybe twice a month). Michael was the only one who was consistently friendly and helpful. <br> <br>Bottom line, too much cost and too many problems.

2003 - 2004 Recommended Property Reviewed 06/07/2004
The Lodge at Southpoint is a decent place to live. There are both good points and bad points about the complex. First, the good: <br>1. All new, really clean and modern apartments <br>2. Nicely-appointed clubhouse with fitness center, billiards room, theater, and lounge area <br>3. Convenient to Duke, UNC-Chapel Hill, RTP, and the RDU Airport <br>4. Full-size washer and dryer in every apartment <br>5. Maintenance is always fairly prompt, generally within a day or two of a call. <br>-------------------------------------------- <br>Now, the bad: <br>1. It is situated right across from the Streets at Southpoint and the site of the future Target store. It is extremely difficult to drive outside the apartment during the month of December, or on most weekend afternoons and evenings in the winter. Also, this makes for an extremely noisy environment. Every now and then, some of the mallgoers park and walk around the grounds. <br>2. It is not recommended to walk across the grass unlike you like the sight and smell of dog droppings on your shoe. Very few people actually follow the apartment rules and clean up after their pets, making for a hidden, but always-present annoyance. <br>3. I had some disgusting neighbors across the way. They would leave their garbage out for days at a time, often with "garbage water" oozing down the stairs and hallways. The management eventually spoke to them after months of complaining. <br>4. Nice pool, but no enforcement of pool rules. Often, small children in diapers are allowed to play in the pool. On two occasions last summer, dirty diapers were left on the pool lounge chairs. <br>5. Very expensive. These apartments are among the most expensive in Chapel Hill and Durham. While the apartment offers many amenities, they don't add up to the price of rent. <br>------------------------------------------ <br>Ov this is a decent place to live for anyone in the RTP area, despite the downfalls. I would probably renew my lease if I weren't moving out of state. <br> <br>

I have to say that I have had no problems while living at the Lodge. The property is really nice and the extras are wonderful. The rent is outrageous for this area. You have to drive to throw away your trash. No one picks up dog poop and the staff does not respond to problems with other residents. It is a shame that my wife and I are leaving because of the poor office management. For the money we pay we should have trash pick-up, resident meetings to discuss problems, and maybe even maintenence that shows up within 3 weeks. We do not even have a business center to conduct business. You kind find the same apartment and find the same quality in Raleigh for less money. Remember this is Durham, Even though this place is nice the projects are just around the corner.

We have lived at the Lodge for going on 2 years now. When we first moved in, we were impressed with the apartment proper, the staff and maintenance issues. About 2 months after moving in, we had "new neighbors" move in upstairs. We live on the 2nd floor and they moved into the 3rd floor apartment over us (a couple with a small toddler).... <br> <br>The first week they were there, the noise was unbearable. We tried to be civil and left a note of their door introducing ourselves and asking for respect in the area of noise. The note was returned to our door with a nasty response basically telling us never to leave a blankity blankity note on their door again. <br> <br>We complained to management and nothing was done. The noise level improved, then worsened. The child loves to bounce a ball, ride a toy around on the noncarpeted areas of the apartment, and the adults have the heaviest feeting of anyone I have ever encountered. It´s bad when you have to rearrange photos on the wall and have maintenance come in to adjust an over hear light because of the devastating noise from above. <br> <br>We filed written complaints to management, and this was the response. We were told that they would "address the issue", but the only thing that would really be done was for us to move to another apartment. I ask you, why would we have to go to the expense and trouble of packing, moving, changing utilities (which cost money), changing addresses, etc when it´s NOT OUR FAULT!? <br> <br>I have never encountered a situation where management is afraid to deal with the REAL ISSUE!!! <br> <br>Another problem with these apartments is they are POORLY insulated. If you live here, your enerygy bill will be OUT OF THE ROOF, so beware!! <br> <br>OVERALL...bad place to live. I would not recommend to my enemies. <br> <br>

2003 Recommended Property Reviewed 08/28/2003
Yes, these apartments are expensive, but consider what you get: a washer and dryer, berber carpet, fairly new structures, 2 sinks in most of the bathrooms, large tubs, computer "nooks", lots of cable hook-ups (sometimes on both sides of the same room), stone tile entrances, huge pool, theater (where else would you get that?!), billiards room, barbeques, sand volleyball, GREAT workout room (most apartments´ workout rooms don´t have NEARLY as much equipment), events, beautiful landscaping, friendly staff, walking distance to the mall... Yes, you can hear the neighbors a bit, yes there´s dog poopie everywhere, and yes sometimes the maintenance people are a bit annoying, but that happens everywhere! Considering the two months free rent, the deposit waiver (since we´re both on the preferred employer program list), and the washer and dryer included, we figure this apartment is the best value in the area for our money.

Resident
2002 - 2003 Recommended Property Reviewed 07/09/2003
I have lived at The Lodge for a year now and am very pleased. I will be renewing my lease for next year. <br> <br>What I like about living there are the pool, gym (yes, one of the threamills is broken and the eliptical machine is no good) but it is a decent gym for an apt complex. I do wish we had aerobic classes more often than once a week. The mountain bikes are also in bad condition and need to be replaced, but no other apt has free bikes that you can use. <br> <br>I have had prompt repairs done when needed. <br> <br>The staff is usually very nice and they do try to organize activities to make the community more enjoyable. I was particularly pleased to leave for work one morning and find them at the main entrance giving away breakfast food to go. <br> <br>The apartments are very nice, and I have not heard any noises from the apts above and below mine - only snoring noises from the one next door (the head of my bed and my neighboor´s must be against the same wall) and once in a while I can hear my neighboor´s alarm clock. <br> <br>Parking is not good after 10pm - you have to park far from your apt in a not so well lit area - and I don´t feel very safe parking there... but nothing "bad" has ever happened. <br> <br>There are many things that could be improved, but in all I think it is a pretty good place to live in, especially compared to other aptartments in the area. <br> <br>The price is a bit too high - but it is worth it if you get the 2 months of free rent that they offer now. If next time I have to renew my lease they don´t offer me free rent I may have to find a new community. But I do like living there, and do plan to stay for another year. I consider it a B community for this area. <br>

Resident
2002 - 2003 Not Recommended Reviewed 05/08/2003
When I first saw The Lodge, I was extremely impressed because of its newness and the pool (I know, that is really sad). But throughout the course of the year, I began to realize that it is NOT worth the money. Granted, it is nice compared to a lot of apartments in the area, but the biggest problem that we had was the noise. It is SO aggravating to constantly hear your neighbors above and below you. If it didn´t sound like there were elephants above us, then we heard either the play station, the bass, or the sex below us. I know a lot of people who live in The Lodge and they also had the same problems with noise. Another major problem was the parking. If you got home after 10 pm, you were probably not going to find a parking spot anywhere near your apartment. I don´t mind walking a little, but I DID NOT feel safe hiking it through the parking lot at 1 or 2 in the morning by myself. One other annoyance is the trash situation. There is only one dumpster, and how that is supposed to serve an entire apartment complex, I don´t know. It is usually overflowing with garbage, and I think if I am going to be paying that much for a place to live, I shouldn´t have to hurdle bags of trash to get to the dumpster or better yet, look at the spillage period. On the plus side, the amenities are great and I thought the staff was very nice (big improvement from when we first moved in), but I suppose it´s all a matter of individual priority. If you want to live in a quiet apartment, this is not the place.

2003 Not Recommended Reviewed 04/29/2003
I was the first and only person to live in my apartment, so that was obviously nice. But in the two years that I´ve lived here, my satisfaction has dropped (while the rent has gone up). I live in the “second phase” so it is at least quieter over here, but have heard some horror stories from the main community regarding noise. <br> <br>Foremost, the safety has dropped significantly...the mall brings in a lot of traffic (which is bad sometimes). The other day I was stopped by Durham police (crime stoppers)asking if I had seen anything unusual since there had supposedly been a lot of crime in the area recently. My neighbor had his car broken into a few days ago as well. We also get notices from the office almost once every two months about "recent crime." I don´t think of the crime is too serious, but worrisome nonetheless. Also, parking can be a nightmare (especially on Sunday nights). I really worry about parking my car so far away, considering the fear of break-ins. Final complaint – the workout room. I’ve had to join a gym (another $40 a month) because I just cannot get a good workout here. One of the TWO treadmills has been broken for a few months, the elliptical trainer is HORRIBLE, and free weights only up to 30lbs. The equipment may work for some, but for anyone who is into fitness it just doesn’t cut it. <br> <br>I must admit that some things have gone well here – otherwise would not have stayed for two years. Big dogs are allowed, which is rare around here (just wish people would clean up after their pets). My experience with maintenance has been helpful (could be better though). My front door has plagued me since I moved in – chronically gets jammed and I am stuck in or out of my apartment (despite numerous Kong-fu pulls and kicks). Ideally, they would have replaced the door long ago. Office staff has been good as far as I’m concerned – but I really don’t mingle with them frequently. Location has been nice, especially for me (close enough to UNC, but far enough to get away a little). <br> <br>I would give the apartment a C grade – average. But the price is certainly well ABOVE AVERAGE. I just don’t know if you get what you pay for. <br> <br>

Resident
2001 - 2003 Not Recommended Reviewed 03/21/2003
The first year at the Lodge was great, the staff was friendly and went out of their way to assist you. It seems as though as soon as the rent increased the customer service decreased. The staff was not as friendly and maintenance of the property went downhill as well. I don´t really understand what happened. After the first year around lease renewal time the staff went out of their way to make sure we were satisfied and we were even given a super deal to ensure that we would stay on another year. That was the first and last time that happened. The next at renewal time the staff could have cared less whether we stayed or left. Whenever we would go into the office to pay rent they would want to know why we came inside to do that because there was a drop box outside. <br>Oh, and if you are moving out, do your self a big financial favor and make sure you do 2 things: 1) request to have a walk through, because it is not something that is automatically done, they only do it upon request. 2)take your own set of pictures so you can have proof of the condition you are leaving the apartment in. Otherwise you might be told that you have left the apartment in bad condition resulting in you oweing additional monies. Then, when you ask them to show you the pictures that they supposedly have on file, they are not able to produce them. This then results in them having to refund you, but it takes them almost 3 months to do so. I ask you this, if the shoe was on the other foot and the resident was 3 months late paying rent What Would The Lodge Do (WWTLD)? Sounds like eviction and late payment fee time to me. Hmmm, not a bad idea.

Resident
2002 - 2003 Recommended Property Reviewed 01/24/2003
This is a great place to live especially with the new Streets at Southpoint so close to go shopping. There are a few quirks that need to be worked out by the staff. One is the maintenance crew and their so called professional workmanship. Also the community dump on the weekends is a NIGHTMARE in itself if you can get to it to put away your trash. Another issue is the noise level from the upstairs apartment. I mean it sounds like the roof is caving when they walk. The staff is professional in their own way, but they will never tell you about all the problems when showing the apartments. The other major issue is the lack of concern when it comes to people and their pets. Yes I will be the first to say it PICK UP AFTER YOUR PETS. There I feel better. I have 2 dogs and when they go out I have a bag in hand, but neighbors do not so watch where you step.

Resident
2002 - 2003 Recommended Property Reviewed 01/22/2003
I have been living at the Lodge since June and for the most part, I´ve liked it a lot. <br>For one, I feel safe here. It´s in a great location, the workout room is awesome, the pool is open 24hrs (a plus, except when drunk people decide they want to come out and skinny dip late night), and it´s a beautiful community. <br>The staff can be either nice or just stand-offish, but we all can from time to time. <br>The apartments are beautiful, but not the most efficient. I spend a lot on my heating and air conditioning, so that definately doesn´t help considering how pricey this place already is. Corner apartments are, ofcourse, the worse. Another thing, our hot water heater refuses to hold more than 10 minutes of warm water, and being a girl that really stinks trying to wash my hair, body, and shave all at one time. We called about it to the office, but no one ever came out to fix it. I guess they just forgot or lost our request. Lastly, the parking can sometimes be a pain. Spaces fill up fast and I have had to make some pretty good hikes from my car to my apartment or vice-versa, but I realize it´s because there is no assigned or restricted parking. Trust me staff--IF ANY OF YOU READ IT--It´s not that big of a deal. <br>But really, this is a nice place. I feel safe, it´s in a nice location, and they are such pretty apartments.

2002 Recommended Property Reviewed 12/07/2002
The apartments are well built. For the most part on a cold day, the apt stays warm and on a hot day it stays cool. I have lived there for 8 months. Mgt is responsive to problems with the apt. Normal response time is 24hrs. I´ve only had minor problems. Walls seem be to be thick cause I can barely hear what my neighbors are doing. Location is great, close to the highway, mall and RTP. I can get to RTP within 15 minutes, anytime of the day :) The location is secure. I´ve left my car open, my mistake a couple of times and the car was still there the next morning. Bad things with the apt is that its pricey...Without the move-in special I wouldn´t have moved there. There is dog poop all over the grass. Residents are bad about picking up their dog´s stuff. There is no storage room in the apts, but if you live lean, the closet is big enough. The garbage disposal units and recyling centres are located in horrible locations and the units are normally full and people leave their garbage by the side of the garbage center. :(

Resident
2001 - 2002 Recommended Property Reviewed 10/18/2002
I have lived in a great number of apt. communities, and this one has more of a "home" feeling than anyplace I have been. The amenities are very much like a resort (billiards room, theater, social director, fitness instructor, etc...) and the apartments themselves have all the luxuries of a single-family home. There´s berber carpet, crown molding, computer centers, garages and a lot more. No place is perfect, but everybody here is very nice, they love my "baby" (a 90 lb. lab) and are in a great location. I highly recommend to anyone.
